Roy Keane spots big boost for Man United just three games into Ruben Amorim era
===============================================================================

Manchester United scored four as they defeated Everton comfortably at Old Trafford in the Premier League on Sunday afternoon
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments4](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/roy-keane-spots-big-boost-30493107#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   20:39, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United icon Roy Keane](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30493149.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Keane-3-011224.jpg)

Manchester United icon Roy Keane has spotted a big boost for Ruben Amorim (Image: Sky Sports)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United legend Roy Keane believes Ruben Amorim's ability to get the strikers scoring again at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) is a big positive for the Reds so early into his new era.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were dominant on Sunday afternoon as [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) both bagged braces as Everton were thrashed at the Theatre of Dreams. The result moved United up into the top half of the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and ensured Amorim secured two wins from his first week in the dugout.

In his opening three games, the forward players have been responsible for all of United's goals with Rashford having three to his name, [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and Zirkzee having two each and Alejandro Garnacho bagging one too. This is a drastic change following the [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) era which saw United struggle to score most matchdays.

**READ MORE: [Amorim praises Van Nistelrooy after 4-0 win](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-praises-ruud-van-30491923)**

**READ MORE: [Amorim makes Rashford claim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-makes-marcus-rashford-30492463)**

[Keane](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/roy-keane) picked up on this when asked for his thoughts on Sky Sports following Manchester City's defeat to [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) in the Premier League. "Do you know what, the fact they have scored four goals again today and the strikers are scoring goals \[is impressive\]," he told the Super Sunday panel.

"Whatever the problems [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) have had over the last year or so, they have not been scoring goals so four today against Everton... Everton defensively were all over the place and gave away huge mistakes.

"But the attacking players are scoring goals and that is a big boost for United on the back of scoring three goals in Europe. So yeah, a big plus for United today."

Amorim will hope this positive momentum will continue in midweek when United face the tough trip to in-form Arsenal on Wednesday night. A victory in North London would move the Reds to within three points of the Gunners.

5.  [### 16:24 1 DecemberMan Utd 'far from perfect' in win over Everton - Amorim. Video, 00:03:23, published at 16:24 1 DecemberMan Utd 'far from perfect' in win over Everton - Amorim](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/videos/c5y311xzvxko)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Premier League](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/premier-league)
        
    
    3:23
    
    ![Image 25: Ruben Amorim](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/1841/live/6e619e60-affe-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg)
    
6.  ![Image 26: Marcus Rashford and Andre Onana of Manchester United react after the team's victory in the Premier League match between Manchester United FC and Everton FC](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/7d3d/live/a40cc8f0-affe-11ef-a88f-9db5c484bac5.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United's win over Everton at Old Trafford under Ruben Amorim is the biggest margin of victory for a permanent manager in their first home match in the competition for the club.
    
    Marcus Rashford has now scored in back-to-back Premier League matches under Ruben Amorim (three goals), as many goals as he managed in his previous 23 matches under both Ruud van Nistelrooy and Erik ten Hag.
    
7.  ![Image 27: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim gestures on the touchline during the English Premier League football match between Manchester United and Everton at Old Trafford ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1e19/live/ad56b3c0-affa-11ef-a58d-210a453eafad.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has been talking to BBC Match of the Day after the win:** "It was far from a perfect performance. We have to improve, you can feel that in the game. After 15 minutes, Everton controlled the game and it was difficult for us and we were losing the second balls.
    
    "I felt that the players could solve some problems that we had as a team because of the quality that they have, but it was far from a perfect performance. But it was a really good result and a tough match."
    
    **On their opening goal:** "You have to congratulate the players and the rest of the staff. The most important thing on set-pieces is the staff, so great job.
    
    "You can see how tall they are and how small we are as a team, so we tried to see where we would have space to create danger."
    
    **On Amad Diallo:** "He is really big in talent, but small in size. He did a great job but he also has to improve. He is in a great moment. Ruud van Nistelrooy helped him a lot in his games in charge and now he is helping me."
    
    **On the mood becoming more buoyant and optimistic:** "It helps to have a new face, it always helps. We have to be very clear to our fans and this will always help.
    
    "Rather than trying to convince the fans about this performance, \[it is better to say\] we have a lot to do, it will take time. Sometimes we are not playing well but everyone defended together.
    
    "Our fans just ask for hard work and then, in time, they will ask for better football."
    
8.  ![Image 28: Marcus Rashford of Manchester United celebrates Jarrad Branthwaite of Everton scoring an own goal during the Premier League match between Manchester United FC and Everton FC at Old Trafford on December 01, 2024](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/3351/live/3e436130-affb-11ef-a58d-210a453eafad.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford has been talking to Sky Sports following the victory:** "It is a nice result. It is important with a new coach and a new way of playing, when we are still learning. We have to back up this performance and win midweek.
    
    "We all, as individuals, want to get back to our best and then push to improve so, even in the bad moments, you are doing the right thing.
    
    "The connection is going to build and grow the more we get used to him. He has \[Ruben Amorim\] come in a busy period and hopefully the connection keeps building and growing. He has come in with a great attitude and it has passed onto the players.
    
    "The atmosphere is one of the most special things about his club, and playing at this great stadium is always a great feeling.
    
    "It is early on but I feel energised and ready for the next game. This game has only just finished, but the next one is always the focus for the players."

13.  ![Image 36: Chris Sutton's predictions v boxer Sunny Edwards](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/7ed7/live/fc95ce60-ae44-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.png.webp)
    
    Chris Sutton is making predictions for all 380 Premier League games this season, against a variety of guests.
    
    For week 13, he takes on boxer Sunny Edwards who is a Chelsea fan.
    
    **Sutton's prediction: 1-1**
    
    There has been so much hype, or even over-hype, about Manchester United. I feel a bit sorry for their new manager Ruben Amorim because he needs time, and two or three transfer windows, to put things right.
    
    There was a lot of excitement over the way they started his first game in charge, against [Ipswich](http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), but blimey you have got a problem if the Tractor Boys are out-playing you, which is what happened in the end.
    
    Things got worse for Amorim when Ed Sheeran interrupted his interview on Sky afterwards. I have to give credit to commentator Conor McNamara here, but maybe it is time for Amorim to listen to one of Sheeran's biggest hits and think about 'the shape of Man U'.
    
    I think the reality is hitting home about Amorim using his favoured 3-4-3 formation with their current squad - especially with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in midfield.
    
    As for Everton, well a fair few of their fans still seem to be on Sean Dyche's back, and they couldn't find a way past 10-man [Brentford](http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/brentford) last week.
    
    This time, they will be the team looking to hold out and I believe they can do it because this Manchester United team is going to take a while to click.
    
    Once the initial buzz of Amorim's first home game dies down, things could go flat at Old Trafford - the way it has done quite a lot recently.
    
    I hope it happens for them under Amorim because he seems like a decent guy, but he's in the Manchester United madhouse now and he's about to find out what it's like to be under the microscope every single week.
    
    **Sunny's prediction: 3-0**
    
    Manchester United haven't been great, but I think they are going to play well in this one.
    
    [Read the full predictions and have your say here](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/ce89x1d34zko)

15.  ![Image 39: Ruben Amorim Manager of Manchester United during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD5 training and press conference at Carrington Training Ground on November 27, 2024](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/abf0/live/64ff98c0-af33-11ef-bf13-0d5fafac0b95.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    BBC Sport presenter Mark Chapman has been getting to know Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim in an exclusive Football Focus interview, with the Portuguese manager explaining why he appears to be "very relaxed" in his new job.
    
    "I will be OK - no matter what," Amorim said. "In this stage of my life, I will be OK so that's why I am relaxed.
    
    "Everybody says to me: 'This will change me'. This will not change me.
    
    "If something happens, I will be frustrated for a while but I know I will recover. But I believe that we are going to succeed.
    
    "I'm ready. When I had this invitation, I felt that it was really hard to leave my players at Sporting. But, when I had this opportunity, I felt I had to do this \[and make the move\].
    
    "Maybe it is destiny and I will be a little bit lucky in the beginning and then everything is going to be fine."
    
    Watch the full interview with Ruben Amorim on [Football Focus on iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episodes/b006m8tc/football-focus) or listen to the special [Football Daily podcast on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr)

16.  ![Image 42: Ruben Amorim, head coach of Manchester United, during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD5 match between Manchester United and FK Bodo/Glimt at Old Trafford](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1a87/live/b06baf40-af26-11ef-907d-d11d58b97d6a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Ruben Amorim has become the latest manager to be tasked with restoring Manchester United's on-pitch fortunes.
    
    The club paid £11m to Portuguese club Sporting to recruit the 39-year-old and his staff, making him the sixth permanent manager since Sir Alex Ferguson's illustrious 26-year reign ended with his retirement in 2013.
    
    After a draw at Ipswich and a win against Bodo/Glimt in his first two games, his side host Everton on Sunday (13:30 GMT).
    
    BBC Sport presenter Mark Chapman caught up with the Portuguese manager on Football Focus, firstly asking him if he is already feeling a connection with the Manchester United fans.
    
    "Yes for sure, I feel that" Amorim revealed. "Maybe because I'm a little bit of an emotional person. I can transmit that, even in interviews, I think.
    
    "Maybe because I am different from the last coach and this can bring a different connection with the next guy.
    
    "I believe that I am the right guy. People always believe the next guy is the right guy. We always have this feeling.
    
    "To maintain this feeling, we have to play better and win games and be really honest with the supporters.
    
    "If you are honest and direct with the supporters - maybe you don't always say the popular thing - you can create a better connection."
    
    Watch the full interview with Ruben Amorim on [Football Focus on iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episodes/b006m8tc/football-focus) or listen to the special [Football Daily podcast on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr)

19.  ![Image 47: Mason Mount warms up before a Manchester United match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/eca4/live/2bd50e50-ae29-11ef-be95-a1f725d18284.jpg.webp)Image source, PA Media
    
    Mason Mount is a "proper footballer" who wants to succeed at Manchester United, says head coach Ruben Amorim.
    
    Mount, 25, joined from [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in the summer of 2023 but his time at Old Trafford so far has been hampered by injury issues.
    
    He started against Bodo/Glimt and played for an hour of Thursday's Europa League victory.
    
    Amorim talked about his "belief" in Mount and said of the England midfielder: "The first thing is he's working really hard. Then you have to understand the human also - he wants this really badly, and that is the most important thing.
    
    "He has proved he is a really talented player. He was a European champion, so we believe in him a lot.
    
    "He has to stay fit and, like all the guys in the team, they are quality players, they have to improve and believe in themselves.
    
    "On Thursday he did a great job. You see some moments and details where you can see that Mason is a proper footballer. We believe in him a lot and I especially believe a lot in Mason."
    
    After a draw at [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) in his first game in charge, Amorim is hopeful of a first Premier League win as United boss against [Everton](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/everton) on Sunday (13:30 GMT).
    
    "It's going to be a different match with a lot of fighting for long balls and second balls," he added.
    
    "They have a quality coach who understands the league and understands the moment of the opponent. We need to have the ball because we have a short time to recover.
    
    "I hope for a win and I hope to see different things in my team improve, like we did from Ipswich to now, against Everton, without training. I expect to see different things and better things."

    We asked for your thoughts after Thursday's Europa League game between Manchester United and Bodo/Glimt.
    
    Here are some of your comments:
    
    **Mike:** It's still early days and improvements are needed, but we are seeing fluid and attacking football return. Garnacho can't cross or shoot. Bodo/Glimt should wrap up their second successive domestic title at the weekend - they would have destroyed an Erik ten Hag team, so they are no walkover! Great possession in positions where it mattered and 20 shots! Hojlund was great.
    
    **Adam:** Taking the lead so early and then throwing it away to go 2-1 down so soon after just shows the frailty of the new system. We were exposed too often but, thankfully, they weren't the strongest of teams so we got off lightly. The major positive of the night has to be Hojlund. He is showing that if you feed him properly, he will do the rest!
    
    **Amogh:** Ruben Amorim showed he is decisive with substitutions and tactically flexible. My worry is that he doesn't have the players to play the system that he wants to play, and that means people playing out of position and not to their strengths. You can get away with that against a mid-table team, but not against a top eight team in the Premier League.
    
    **Brendan:** Ugarte is the glue that keeps this team together. He is a similar player to Roy Keane - impressive. Malacia had so much ball but he was not able to cope with or penetrate the defence. Shaw was dependable as usual. Rashford, regretfully, is a total lost cause and he needs to move on.
    
    **Alex:** Positive signs, definitely, but we have to make sure we don't get too excited. The great thing is that we are starting to see an identity within this team, which we haven't seen in a very long time. I'm very interested to see where we go from here and what our optimal line-up will be.

Ruben Amorim makes Marcus Rashford claim after Manchester United win
====================================================================

Marcus Rashford scored twice in Man Utd's comfortable win over Everton and Ruben Amorim was asked about his display.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-makes-marcus-rashford-30492463#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Steven Railston](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/steven-railston/)Manchester United Writer

*   17:11, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated17:15, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491402.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187193341.jpg)

Rashford scored a brace.

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim agreed Marcus Rashford showed "he wanted it" by scoring a brace in Manchester United's dominant 4-0 victory over Everton on Sunday.

Amorim said when asked about Rashford at his press conference last week: "We'll try to find the right solution for him but he has to be Marcus, first of all, to try to return to that moment."

He added that Rashford "has to be the first one to want it" and the United academy graduate responded to that challenge by scoring an impressive brace against Everton.

Rashford scored the first goal of Amorim's tenure when finding the net after just 81 seconds against Ipswich Town at Portman Road and now has seven goals in all competitions.

**ALSO READ: [United player ratings from Everton fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**ALSO READ:** **[Ratcliffe must make a U-turn after United price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kick-teeth-sir-jim-ratcliffe-30475527)**

Amorim was asked whether Rashford's performance against Everton was an example of him "wanting it" and responded: "Yeah, yeah... he can do so much. He has to continue to improve.

"He has the ability to do that but he can play so much better, like the other guys. It was a good performance, tomorrow he has to recover and start thinking about Arsenal."

Zirkzee also scored twice on Sunday and Amorim discussed his display. "First thing, I need all the players to cope with all the games and he’s one of them. I just try to put my players in good positions for their characteristics," he said.

"It would have been really hard, even for Rasmus \[Hojlund\], to fight with the two centre-backs of Everton, so we try and push them to a position that they weren’t so comfortable and Josh did a great job.

"He scored two goals, which is always important for the confidence. But more important than that was his performance because he fought in every situation. It was a good day for him and our team."

United's win against Everton moved them into the top half of the table. "I understand that it’s hard for me to say no because you would say I can’t be a [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) coach, but I want to be honest with our fans," said Amorim about potential [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) qualification.

"So let’s focus on the performance and not the results. We’ll see in the end. I’ve said this many times, I will be judged on where we finish, I know that, but let’s focus on the next game and look at the performance.

"On Thursday, it was a 3-2 and I think we deserved more. Today was 4-0 but I thought Everton deserved more. Let’s focus on the performance, congratulations to the lads, let’s rest, recover and think about Arsenal."

'I have a sneaky feeling' - pundits disagree on Manchester United vs Everton score prediction
=============================================================================================

Man United will be going in search of their first Premier League win under Ruben Amorim against Everton on Sunday.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   18:15, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United's players celebrate with Rasmus Hojlund after his goal against Bodo/Glimt.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30488306.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186679484.jpg)

Manchester United will be eyeing another victory on Sunday afternoon. (Image: Oli Scarff/AFP via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United will be targeting a second successive victory when they welcome Everton to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) recorded their first win of the Ruben Amorim era in midweek, beating Bodo/Glimt 3-2 in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league). United recovered from 2-1 down to secure all three points, inspired by a [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) brace.

Amorim will now be keen to oversee his first [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) victory as United boss after his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town at Portman Road last weekend finished in a 1-1 draw.

**READ MORE:** **[Chido Obi-Martin marks landmark United moment by scoring again for Under-18s](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

United will fancy their chances of getting the better of an Everton side that has won just one of six away league games this season. But how do the pundits think the contest will unfold at Old Trafford?

**Chris Sutton - BBC Sport**

"I think the reality is hitting home about Amorim using his favoured 3-4-3 formation with their current squad - especially with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in midfield," Sutton told [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/ce89x1d34zko). "As for Everton, well a fair few of their fans still seem to be on Sean Dyche's back, and they could not find a way past Brentford's 10 men last week.

"This time, they will be the team looking to hold out and I believe they can do it because this United team is going to take a while to click. Once the initial buzz of Amorim's first home game dies down, things could go flat at Old Trafford, the way it has done quite a lot recently.

"I hope it happens for them under Amorim because he seems like a decent guy, but he is in the [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) madhouse now and he is about to find out what it is like to be under the microscope every single week."

**Prediction:** _United 1-1 Everton_

**Paul Merson - Sportskeeda**

Merson, penning his prediction for [Sportskeeda](https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/news-paul-merson-predicts-liverpool-vs-manchester-city-premier-league-gw13-fixtures), wrote: "Nothing changed for Manchester United last week, in my opinion. Ipswich were by far the better team.

"I'm not entirely convinced about Manchester United's new system under Amorim. After a point in that game, you would've thought Ipswich were the bigger club and not United – that's how it went.

"You could say everyone was away on international duty and he did not have enough time. But if that performance were against one of the big boys in the league, Manchester United would have been destroyed by four or five goals.

"Everton are a team who have a special X-factor in them. They always have that one fixture every season when they just spring to life and surprise us. I'm going for a United win, but I can't help but admit that I have a sneaky feeling about Everton."

**Prediction:** _United 2-0 Everton_

**Mark Lawrenson - Paddy Power**

Everton can't stop drawing and they're certainly not scoring much," Lawrenson told [Paddy Power](https://news.paddypower.com/football/2024/11/30/football-accumulator-tips-footyaccums-best-bets-today-saturday/). "With home advantage and the crowd behind them in Ruben Amorim's first game at Old Trafford Manchester United should win this."

**Prediction:** _United 2-1 Everton_

[Amad Diallo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) impressed for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) during their 4-0 win over Everton at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). The Ivorian, who was handed another Premier League start by Ruben Amorim, grabbed two assists against the Toffees on Sunday.

After being involved in both of United's first two goals, Amad added his first assist just after half-time. He dribbled at the Everton back-line before feeding through Marcus Rashford, who slotted beyond Jordan Pickford.

It felt as though the 22-year-old started to go through the gears from that point and he produced another piece of magic to put United 4-0 ahead. Amad won the ball back inside the Everton half before sliding a pass into Joshua Zirkzee, who made no mistake and tucked home into the bottom corner.

**READ MORE: [Marcus Rashford sends clear message to Ruben Amorim after Man United demand](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/marcus-rashford-immediately-responds-ruben-30491674)**

**READ MORE: [Marcus Rashford sends Arsenal warning ahead of Man United clash](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/marcus-rashford-immediately-responds-ruben-30491674)**

After the game, Amad took to Instagram to send a message to the United supporters following the thumping win over Everton. He said in a caption: "We keep going," followed by a flexed biceps emoji. Thanks fans for the support," alongside a love heart emoji.

There is no doubt that Amad has improved this season and Amorim, who was appointed as the new United head coach on November 1, has since hailed Ruud van Nistelrooy for helping the winger. Van Nistelrooy won three of his four matches as interim head coach after the sacking of Erik ten Hag, but left his position on November 11 with Amorim deciding to recruit his own backroom staff.

Speaking in a post-match interview, Amorim told BBC's Match of the Day: "He is really big in talent, but small in size. He did a great job but he is also has to improve. He is a great moment. Ruud van Nistelrooy helped him a lot in his games in charge and now he's helping me."

The win for United has moved them up to ninth, four points off the [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) places. They have won five, drawn four and lost four of their 13 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) matches so far this season.

"It was far from a perfect performance," Amorim added. "We have to improve, you can feel that in the game. After 15 minutes Everton controlled the game and it was difficult for us and we were losing the second ball. I felt that the players could solve some problems that we have as a team because of the quality that they have but it was far from a perfect performance but a really good result and tough match."

Chido Obi-Martin continues to shine as Manchester United star makes Ruben Amorim admission
==========================================================================================

Here are your latest Man United headlines as the Reds prepare to face Everton in the Premier League.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Share

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-continues-shine-30487226#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Ross Jackson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/ross-jackson/)Sport Content Editor

*   18:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim watches on from the sidelines](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30476144.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186670918.jpg)

Ruben Amorim watches on from the sidelines

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim will be looking to secure his first Premier League win as [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach tomorrow.

The Reds host Everton just three days on from their 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League. That victory over the Norwegian side marked the first win of the Amorim era after United could only draw 1-1 with Ipswich in the Portuguese's first game in charge last weekend.

Everton visit Old Trafford having won just twice in the league this season and Sean Dyche's side haven't scored in their last three games. Ahead of the first home league game of the Amorim era, here's a look at the latest United headlines.

**READ MORE:** **[United supporters group announce ticket price protest ahead of Everton fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-supporters-group-announce-30461312)**

**READ MORE:** **[Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

### Obi-Martin scores again

United striker Chido Obi-Martin celebrated signing his first professional contract by scoring the opener in the Under-18s' 3-0 win over Stoke City on Saturday.

The Danish youth international put [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) ahead with 71 minutes on the clock, converting a penalty, before James Scanlon and Dante Plunkett made sure of the points in the closing stages.

Turning 17 on Friday, [Obi-Martin's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chido-obi-martin) maiden professional contract was allowed to commence at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). The striker signed a scholarship with an agreement for his professional contract to begin when he turned 17 after joining United from Arsenal in the summer.

**READ ON [HERE \>\>\>](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

### Casemiro on Amorim

Casemiro has said all of United's players are 'excited' by the recent appointment of Amorim at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The 39-year-old, who was appointed from Sporting Lisbon earlier this month, oversaw his first victory as [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach on Thursday night, leading his side to a 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

After seeing Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute opener wiped out, United recovered from 2-1 down to clinch their second Europa League win of the campaign.

**READ ON [HERE \>\>\>](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/casemiro-reveals-how-manchester-united-30486654)**

Chido Obi-Martin continues to shine as Manchester United star makes Ruben Amorim admission
==========================================================================================

Here are your latest Man United headlines as the Reds prepare to face Everton in the Premier League.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ruben Amorim watches on from the sidelines

Ruben Amorim will be looking to secure his first Premier League win as [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach tomorrow.

The Reds host Everton just three days on from their 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League. That victory over the Norwegian side marked the first win of the Amorim era after United could only draw 1-1 with Ipswich in the Portuguese's first game in charge last weekend.

Everton visit Old Trafford having won just twice in the league this season and Sean Dyche's side haven't scored in their last three games. Ahead of the first home league game of the Amorim era, here's a look at the latest United headlines.

**READ MORE:** **[United supporters group announce ticket price protest ahead of Everton fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-supporters-group-announce-30461312)**

**READ MORE:** **[Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

### Obi-Martin scores again

United striker Chido Obi-Martin celebrated signing his first professional contract by scoring the opener in the Under-18s' 3-0 win over Stoke City on Saturday.

The Danish youth international put [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) ahead with 71 minutes on the clock, converting a penalty, before James Scanlon and Dante Plunkett made sure of the points in the closing stages.

Turning 17 on Friday, [Obi-Martin's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chido-obi-martin) maiden professional contract was allowed to commence at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). The striker signed a scholarship with an agreement for his professional contract to begin when he turned 17 after joining United from Arsenal in the summer.

**READ ON [HERE \>\>\>](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

### Casemiro on Amorim

Casemiro has said all of United's players are 'excited' by the recent appointment of Amorim at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The 39-year-old, who was appointed from Sporting Lisbon earlier this month, oversaw his first victory as [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach on Thursday night, leading his side to a 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

After seeing Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute opener wiped out, United recovered from 2-1 down to clinch their second Europa League win of the campaign.

Chido Obi-Martin continues to shine as Manchester United star makes Ruben Amorim admission
==========================================================================================

Ruben Amorim will be looking to secure his first Premier League win as [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach tomorrow.

The Reds host Everton just three days on from their 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League. That victory over the Norwegian side marked the first win of the Amorim era after United could only draw 1-1 with Ipswich in the Portuguese's first game in charge last weekend.

Everton visit Old Trafford having won just twice in the league this season and Sean Dyche's side haven't scored in their last three games. Ahead of the first home league game of the Amorim era, here's a look at the latest United headlines.

**READ MORE:** **[United supporters group announce ticket price protest ahead of Everton fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-supporters-group-announce-30461312)**

**READ MORE:** **[Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

### Obi-Martin scores again

United striker Chido Obi-Martin celebrated signing his first professional contract by scoring the opener in the Under-18s' 3-0 win over Stoke City on Saturday.

The Danish youth international put [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) ahead with 71 minutes on the clock, converting a penalty, before James Scanlon and Dante Plunkett made sure of the points in the closing stages.

Turning 17 on Friday, [Obi-Martin's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chido-obi-martin) maiden professional contract was allowed to commence at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). The striker signed a scholarship with an agreement for his professional contract to begin when he turned 17 after joining United from Arsenal in the summer.

**READ ON [HERE \>\>\>](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

### Casemiro on Amorim

Casemiro has said all of United's players are 'excited' by the recent appointment of Amorim at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The 39-year-old, who was appointed from Sporting Lisbon earlier this month, oversaw his first victory as [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach on Thursday night, leading his side to a 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

After seeing Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute opener wiped out, United recovered from 2-1 down to clinch their second Europa League win of the campaign.

Chido Obi-Martin continues to shine as Manchester United star makes Ruben Amorim admission
==========================================================================================

Here are your latest Man United headlines as the Reds prepare to face Everton in the Premier League.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim watches on from the sidelines](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30476144.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186670918.jpg)

Ruben Amorim watches on from the sidelines

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Ruben Amorim will be looking to secure his first Premier League win as [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach tomorrow.

The Reds host Everton just three days on from their 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League. That victory over the Norwegian side marked the first win of the Amorim era after United could only draw 1-1 with Ipswich in the Portuguese's first game in charge last weekend.

Everton visit Old Trafford having won just twice in the league this season and Sean Dyche's side haven't scored in their last three games. Ahead of the first home league game of the Amorim era, here's a look at the latest United headlines.

**READ MORE:** **[United supporters group announce ticket price protest ahead of Everton fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-supporters-group-announce-30461312)**

**READ MORE:** **[Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

### Obi-Martin scores again

United striker Chido Obi-Martin celebrated signing his first professional contract by scoring the opener in the Under-18s' 3-0 win over Stoke City on Saturday.

The Danish youth international put [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) ahead with 71 minutes on the clock, converting a penalty, before James Scanlon and Dante Plunkett made sure of the points in the closing stages.

Turning 17 on Friday, [Obi-Martin's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chido-obi-martin) maiden professional contract was allowed to commence at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). The striker signed a scholarship with an agreement for his professional contract to begin when he turned 17 after joining United from Arsenal in the summer.

**READ ON [HERE \>\>\>](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/chido-obi-martin-marks-landmark-30487111)**

### Casemiro on Amorim

Casemiro has said all of United's players are 'excited' by the recent appointment of Amorim at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The 39-year-old, who was appointed from Sporting Lisbon earlier this month, oversaw his first victory as [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach on Thursday night, leading his side to a 3-2 win over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

After seeing Alejandro Garnacho's first-minute opener wiped out, United recovered from 2-1 down to clinch their second Europa League win of the campaign.

Man United can use same Ruben Amorim transfer trick to sign Viktor Gyokeres in January
======================================================================================

Manchester United are among the clubs rumoured to be interested in Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could repeat the transfer trick that allowed them to poach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) from Sporting CP last month in order to sign striker Viktor Gyokeres.

The 26-year-old has previously played in England with Brighton, Swansea City and Coventry City, but currently plays his football in Portugal with Amorim's former club. It was the United boss who signed him from Coventry back in the summer of 2023, and he has already scored over 60 goals for Sporting across all competitions in just a season and a half.

Gyokeres' inspired form in front of goal has made him a transfer target for a number of top European clubs, including United and [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc). Some reports suggest [he has his heart set on a move to Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-heart-set-one-30473775), although he is seemingly in no rush to leave his current club.

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give Manchester United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim gives Tyrell Malacia verdict and provides Manchester United injury update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

In a recent interview with Swedish outlet Fotbollskanalen, Gyokeres said: "It's not something I think about, nor something I give any importance to. It's just rumours, nothing concrete.

"Of course, I want to finish the season at Sporting. I'm enjoying my time there. I don't feel stressed about making a change in the future. We'll see when the time comes."

That will come as disappointing news for United fans, with the club lacking a clinical striker, despite the arrival of [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) from Bologna over the summer. However, it's worth noting Amorim, too, initially wanted to remain at Sporting until the end of the season.

In one of his final press conferences as manager of Sporting, Amorim told the media: "I had three days to decide one option that radically changes my life.

""The only request I made was for it \[transfer\] to be at the end of the season, and they \[United\] told me that it wasn't possible; that it was now or never. I knew if I rejected it that in six months I wouldn't have it. And I knew that in six months I would know that I wouldn't be at Sporting."

United's insistence they would not wait ultimately forced through the move and ensured they landed their primary managerial target. As United desperately need to close the gap on the top four, supporters will hope they can pull off a similar trick to beat their rivals to Gyokeres' signature in the upcoming transfer windows.

Man United can use same Ruben Amorim transfer trick to sign Viktor Gyokeres in January
======================================================================================

Manchester United are among the clubs rumoured to be interested in Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[Hannah Pinnock](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/hannah-pinnock/)

*   21:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting CP has linked with a move to Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488028.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187194724.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting CP has linked with a move to Manchester United (Image: Photo by David Ramos - UEFA/UEFA via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could repeat the transfer trick that allowed them to poach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) from Sporting CP last month in order to sign striker Viktor Gyokeres.

The 26-year-old has previously played in England with Brighton, Swansea City and Coventry City, but currently plays his football in Portugal with Amorim's former club. It was the United boss who signed him from Coventry back in the summer of 2023, and he has already scored over 60 goals for Sporting across all competitions in just a season and a half.

Gyokeres' inspired form in front of goal has made him a transfer target for a number of top European clubs, including United and [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc). Some reports suggest [he has his heart set on a move to Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-heart-set-one-30473775), although he is seemingly in no rush to leave his current club.

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give Manchester United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim gives Tyrell Malacia verdict and provides Manchester United injury update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

In a recent interview with Swedish outlet Fotbollskanalen, Gyokeres said: "It's not something I think about, nor something I give any importance to. It's just rumours, nothing concrete.

"Of course, I want to finish the season at Sporting. I'm enjoying my time there. I don't feel stressed about making a change in the future. We'll see when the time comes."

That will come as disappointing news for United fans, with the club lacking a clinical striker, despite the arrival of [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) from Bologna over the summer. However, it's worth noting Amorim, too, initially wanted to remain at Sporting until the end of the season.

In one of his final press conferences as manager of Sporting, Amorim told the media: "I had three days to decide one option that radically changes my life.

""The only request I made was for it \[transfer\] to be at the end of the season, and they \[United\] told me that it wasn't possible; that it was now or never. I knew if I rejected it that in six months I wouldn't have it. And I knew that in six months I would know that I wouldn't be at Sporting."

United's insistence they would not wait ultimately forced through the move and ensured they landed their primary managerial target. As United desperately need to close the gap on the top four, supporters will hope they can pull off a similar trick to beat their rivals to Gyokeres' signature in the upcoming transfer windows.

data: {"title":"Man Utd can use same Amorim transfer trick to sign Gyokeres in January","description":"Manchester United are among the clubs rumoured to be interested in Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-can-use-same-30488156","content":"Man United can use same Ruben Amorim transfer trick to sign Viktor Gyokeres in January - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United can use same Ruben Amorim transfer trick to sign Viktor Gyokeres in January
======================================================================================

Manchester United are among the clubs rumoured to be interested in Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-can-use-same-30488156#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Hannah Pinnock](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/hannah-pinnock/)

*   21:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting CP has linked with a move to Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488028.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187194724.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting CP has linked with a move to Manchester United (Image: Photo by David Ramos - UEFA/UEFA via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could repeat the transfer trick that allowed them to poach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) from Sporting CP last month in order to sign striker Viktor Gyokeres.

The 26-year-old has previously played in England with Brighton, Swansea City and Coventry City, but currently plays his football in Portugal with Amorim's former club. It was the United boss who signed him from Coventry back in the summer of 2023, and he has already scored over 60 goals for Sporting across all competitions in just a season and a half.

Gyokeres' inspired form in front of goal has made him a transfer target for a number of top European clubs, including United and [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc). Some reports suggest [he has his heart set on a move to Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-heart-set-one-30473775), although he is seemingly in no rush to leave his current club.

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give Manchester United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim gives Tyrell Malacia verdict and provides Manchester United injury update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

In a recent interview with Swedish outlet Fotbollskanalen, Gyokeres said: "It's not something I think about, nor something I give any importance to. It's just rumours, nothing concrete.

"Of course, I want to finish the season at Sporting. I'm enjoying my time there. I don't feel stressed about making a change in the future. We'll see when the time comes."

That will come as disappointing news for United fans, with the club lacking a clinical striker, despite the arrival of [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) from Bologna over the summer. However, it's worth noting Amorim, too, initially wanted to remain at Sporting until the end of the season.

In one of his final press conferences as manager of Sporting, Amorim told the media: "I had three days to decide one option that radically changes my life.

""The only request I made was for it \[transfer\] to be at the end of the season, and they \[United\] told me that it wasn't possible; that it was now or never. I knew if I rejected it that in six months I wouldn't have it. And I knew that in six months I would know that I wouldn't be at Sporting."

United's insistence they would not wait ultimately forced through the move and ensured they landed their primary managerial target. As United desperately need to close the gap on the top four, supporters will hope they can pull off a similar trick to beat their rivals to Gyokeres' signature in the upcoming transfer windows.

data: {"title":"Man Utd can use same Amorim transfer trick to sign Gyokeres in January","description":"Manchester United are among the clubs rumoured to be interested in Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-can-use-same-30488156","content":"Man United can use same Ruben Amorim transfer trick to sign Viktor Gyokeres in January - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United can use same Ruben Amorim transfer trick to sign Viktor Gyokeres in January
======================================================================================

Manchester United are among the clubs rumoured to be interested in Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-can-use-same-30488156#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Hannah Pinnock](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/hannah-pinnock/)

*   21:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting CP has linked with a move to Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488028.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187194724.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting CP has linked with a move to Manchester United (Image: Photo by David Ramos - UEFA/UEFA via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could repeat the transfer trick that allowed them to poach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) from Sporting CP last month in order to sign striker Viktor Gyokeres.

The 26-year-old has previously played in England with Brighton, Swansea City and Coventry City, but currently plays his football in Portugal with Amorim's former club. It was the United boss who signed him from Coventry back in the summer of 2023, and he has already scored over 60 goals for Sporting across all competitions in just a season and a half.

Gyokeres' inspired form in front of goal has made him a transfer target for a number of top European clubs, including United and [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc). Some reports suggest [he has his heart set on a move to Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-heart-set-one-30473775), although he is seemingly in no rush to leave his current club.

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give Manchester United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)**

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim gives Tyrell Malacia verdict and provides Manchester United injury update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

In a recent interview with Swedish outlet Fotbollskanalen, Gyokeres said: "It's not something I think about, nor something I give any importance to. It's just rumours, nothing concrete.

"Of course, I want to finish the season at Sporting. I'm enjoying my time there. I don't feel stressed about making a change in the future. We'll see when the time comes."

That will come as disappointing news for United fans, with the club lacking a clinical striker, despite the arrival of [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) from Bologna over the summer. However, it's worth noting Amorim, too, initially wanted to remain at Sporting until the end of the season.

In one of his final press conferences as manager of Sporting, Amorim told the media: "I had three days to decide one option that radically changes my life.

""The only request I made was for it \[transfer\] to be at the end of the season, and they \[United\] told me that it wasn't possible; that it was now or never. I knew if I rejected it that in six months I wouldn't have it. And I knew that in six months I would know that I wouldn't be at Sporting."

United's insistence they would not wait ultimately forced through the move and ensured they landed their primary managerial target. As United desperately need to close the gap on the top four, supporters will hope they can pull off a similar trick to beat their rivals to Gyokeres' signature in the upcoming transfer windows.

Man United eye £69m Victor Osimhen swap as January transfer 'targeted'
======================================================================

Manchester United are thought to be on the hunt for a centre-forward following Ruben Amorim's arrival at Old Trafford
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

*   05:00, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Galatasaray's on loan striker Victor Osimhen](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30489224.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186671314.jpg)

Galatasaray's on loan striker Victor Osimhen (Image: JOHN THYS/AFP via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Manchester United are reportedly open to the idea of swapping new signing Joshua Zirkzee for Napoli striker Victor Osimhen in the [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/january-transfer-window).

[Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) has struggled to adapt to life in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) since signing from Bologna in the summer. _MEN Sport_ understands there are some doubts inside United that the Dutchman may not have what it takes to be a regular fixture in [the Reds'](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) squad.

As such, rumours have circulated suggesting a return to Italy is a possibility for the forward. With United looking to bolster their attack, the latest name to be linked with the Reds is [Osimhen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/victor-osimhen).

**READ MORE: [United face up to alarming £43m transfer reality](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-face-up-alarming-30488118)**

**READ MORE: [Amorim gives Malacia verdict](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

The Nigerian was previously a target under [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) but United were unable to afford him at the time. However, a move never materialised in the summer and Osimhen was shipped out on loan to Galatasaray for this season.

It is believed a break clause was included in the loan to allow Osimhen to join one of ten top European clubs. It is unclear whether United are one of them.

According to [Area Napoli](https://www.areanapoli.it/calciomercato/il-mattino---manchester-united-offerto-un-esubero-da-40-milioni-per-osimhen_572848.html), [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are looking to kill two birds with one stone by organising a swap deal with the Naples club. United are thought to be ready to offer £33.2m plus Zirkzee for the talented striker - taking the value of the swap to around £69m.

Since moving to Turkey, Osimhen has bagged eight goals across 11 appearances. Elsewhere, PSV Eindhoven's attacking midfielder Malik Tillman is also thought to be on United's wishlist for January.

The attacking midfielder has impressed in the Eredivisie this season with eight goals and four assists to his name in 19 appearances. However, the former Bayern Munich man's form has not gone unnoticed in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league).

While United are believed to be interested, [Tottenham Hotspur](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/tottenham-hotspur-fc) and [Aston Villa](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/aston-villa-fc) are also thought to be keen. Tillman is believed to favour a move to the Premier League but the Reds would need to splash as much as £33m to bag him this winter.

Man United eye £69m Victor Osimhen swap as January transfer 'targeted'
======================================================================

Manchester United are thought to be on the hunt for a centre-forward following Ruben Amorim's arrival at Old Trafford
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

Manchester United are reportedly open to the idea of swapping new signing Joshua Zirkzee for Napoli striker Victor Osimhen in the [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/january-transfer-window).

[Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) has struggled to adapt to life in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) since signing from Bologna in the summer. _MEN Sport_ understands there are some doubts inside United that the Dutchman may not have what it takes to be a regular fixture in [the Reds'](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) squad.

As such, rumours have circulated suggesting a return to Italy is a possibility for the forward. With United looking to bolster their attack, the latest name to be linked with the Reds is [Osimhen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/victor-osimhen).

**READ MORE: [United face up to alarming £43m transfer reality](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-face-up-alarming-30488118)**

**READ MORE: [Amorim gives Malacia verdict](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

The Nigerian was previously a target under [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) but United were unable to afford him at the time. However, a move never materialised in the summer and Osimhen was shipped out on loan to Galatasaray for this season.

It is believed a break clause was included in the loan to allow Osimhen to join one of ten top European clubs. It is unclear whether United are one of them.

According to [Area Napoli](https://www.areanapoli.it/calciomercato/il-mattino---manchester-united-offerto-un-esubero-da-40-milioni-per-osimhen_572848.html), [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are looking to kill two birds with one stone by organising a swap deal with the Naples club. United are thought to be ready to offer £33.2m plus Zirkzee for the talented striker - taking the value of the swap to around £69m.

Since moving to Turkey, Osimhen has bagged eight goals across 11 appearances. Elsewhere, PSV Eindhoven's attacking midfielder Malik Tillman is also thought to be on United's wishlist for January.

The attacking midfielder has impressed in the Eredivisie this season with eight goals and four assists to his name in 19 appearances. However, the former Bayern Munich man's form has not gone unnoticed in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league).

While United are believed to be interested, [Tottenham Hotspur](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/tottenham-hotspur-fc) and [Aston Villa](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/aston-villa-fc) are also thought to be keen. Tillman is believed to favour a move to the Premier League but the Reds would need to splash as much as £33m to bag him this winter.

Man United eye £69m Victor Osimhen swap as January transfer 'targeted'
======================================================================

Manchester United are thought to be on the hunt for a centre-forward following Ruben Amorim's arrival at Old Trafford
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments3](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-eye-69m-victor-30489144#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   05:00, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Galatasaray's on loan striker Victor Osimhen](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30489224.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186671314.jpg)

Galatasaray's on loan striker Victor Osimhen (Image: JOHN THYS/AFP via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United are reportedly open to the idea of swapping new signing Joshua Zirkzee for Napoli striker Victor Osimhen in the [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/january-transfer-window).

[Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) has struggled to adapt to life in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) since signing from Bologna in the summer. _MEN Sport_ understands there are some doubts inside United that the Dutchman may not have what it takes to be a regular fixture in [the Reds'](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) squad.

As such, rumours have circulated suggesting a return to Italy is a possibility for the forward. With United looking to bolster their attack, the latest name to be linked with the Reds is [Osimhen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/victor-osimhen).

**READ MORE: [United face up to alarming £43m transfer reality](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-face-up-alarming-30488118)**

**READ MORE: [Amorim gives Malacia verdict](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

The Nigerian was previously a target under [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) but United were unable to afford him at the time. However, a move never materialised in the summer and Osimhen was shipped out on loan to Galatasaray for this season.

It is believed a break clause was included in the loan to allow Osimhen to join one of ten top European clubs. It is unclear whether United are one of them.

According to [Area Napoli](https://www.areanapoli.it/calciomercato/il-mattino---manchester-united-offerto-un-esubero-da-40-milioni-per-osimhen_572848.html), [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are looking to kill two birds with one stone by organising a swap deal with the Naples club. United are thought to be ready to offer £33.2m plus Zirkzee for the talented striker - taking the value of the swap to around £69m.

Since moving to Turkey, Osimhen has bagged eight goals across 11 appearances. Elsewhere, PSV Eindhoven's attacking midfielder Malik Tillman is also thought to be on United's wishlist for January.

The attacking midfielder has impressed in the Eredivisie this season with eight goals and four assists to his name in 19 appearances. However, the former Bayern Munich man's form has not gone unnoticed in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league).

While United are believed to be interested, [Tottenham Hotspur](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/tottenham-hotspur-fc) and [Aston Villa](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/aston-villa-fc) are also thought to be keen. Tillman is believed to favour a move to the Premier League but the Reds would need to splash as much as £33m to bag him this winter.
